com.sirqul.sdk

Class Sirqul

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.sirqul.sdk.Sirqul

  • public class Sirqul
extends Object
    The Class Sirqul.

    This is the main interface to making and receiving all API calls with Sirqul services. The SirqulApi subclass methods are thread safe, whereas those in SirqulApiBase are not. It is recommended that if you are to use the non-thread safe ones, that they be wrapped in the SirqulTask class for running on background threads, or your own preferred ASyncTask implementation.

    Supplying your Sirqul application's public and private keys is all that is required to get you set up. You'll pass these values in via a Bundle on initialization using the initialize(Context, Bundle) method. The keys to pair with your values are static String variables within this class. PUBLIC_KEY and PRIVATE_KEY for instance map to your public and private application keys.

    Other settings can be configured upon initialization but have defaults set if you don't explicitly pass anything in. These optional settings include:
    • HOST
      your target host address.
      Default is https://sirqul.com:443/.

    • LOGCAT_TAG
      the tag value that log cat messages will be filed under
      Default is "SIRQUL_SDK".

    • LOG_ENABLED
      whether or not if you'd like network calls to be logged to LogCat.
      This can show potentially sensitive information and is recommended to be false for release.
      Default is false.

    • DEVICE_ID
      the current device's unique deviceId
      Default is Secure.getString(context.getContentResolver(), Secure.ANDROID_ID).

    • API_VERSION
      the target Sirqul API version your app is to target
      Default is 3.04.

    • APP_VERSION
      the AppVersion set to represent the version of your app.
      Default is 1.0.

    • DEVICE
      the current device's name.
      Default is either Build.MODEL or Build.MANUFACTURER + " " + Build.MODEL if Build.MANUFACTURER and Build.MODEL differ.

    • DEVICE_OS
      the current device's OS version.
      Default is "Android OS " + Build.VERSION.RELEASE + " API-" + Build.VERSION.SDK_INT + " " + Build.ID.

    • DEVICE_MODEL
      the current device model.
      Default is Build.MODEL.

    • DEVICE_TYPE
      the current device's type.
      Default is Enums.DeviceType.HANDHELD.

    • CONNECTION_TIMEOUT
      the connection timeout for general api calls.
      Default is 10000ms.

    • CONNECTION_TIMEOUT_FOR_FILE_UPLOADS
      the connection timeout for file uploads.
      Default is 20000ms.

    • SOCKET_TIMEOUT
      the socket timeout for general api calls.
      Default is 30000ms.

    • SOCKET_TIMEOUT_FOR_FILE_UPLOADS
      the socket timeout for file uploads.
      Default is 300000ms.

    • CUSTOM_USER_AGENT
      a custom user agent, if needed.
      Default is SIRQUL.

    • RETURN_FORMATTED_JSON_STRINGS
      a flag that when enabled, appends a formatted json string of the response on the base response object.
      Default is false.

    • RETURN_JSON_STRINGS
      a flag that when enabled, appends a non-formatted json string of the response on the base response object.
      Default is false.

    • TCP_NO_DELAY_ENABLED
      If false, Nagle's algorithm will be used to help increase latency at a cost of performance.
      Default is true.

        Returns:
        the returnNullCustomObjs, which determines whether or not to return null custom class objects from response object class's getter methods. Includes all data and response classes.

      • returnNullEnums

        public static boolean returnNullEnums()
        Return null enums.
        Returns:
        the returnNullEnums, which determines whether or not to return null enum values from response object class's getter methods. Otherwise, a NULL enum value of that class type is returned.

      • returnNullLists

        public static boolean returnNullLists()
        Return null lists.
        Returns:

        public static boolean returnNullPrimitives()
        Return null primitives.
        Returns:
        the returnNullPrimitives, which determines whether or not to return null primitive types from response object class's getter methods. Includes String, int, float, double, and long.

      • initialize

        public boolean initialize(Context context,
                 Bundle bundle)
        Initialize the SDK. This must be called prior to using the Sirqul class.

        You must pass in a Bundle with at least the following values:
        • PUBLIC_KEY
          your Sirqul app's public api key. There is no default, making this required.

        • PRIVATE_KEY
          your Sirqul app's private api key. There is no default, making this required.


        Optional values for further customization include:
        • HOST
          your target host address.
          Default is https://sirqul.com:443/.

        • LOGCAT_TAG
          the tag value that log cat messages will be filed under
          Default is "SIRQUL_SDK".

        • LOG_ENABLED
          whether or not if you'd like network calls to be logged to LogCat.
          This can show potentially sensitive information and is recommended to be false for release.
          Default is false.

        • DEVICE_ID
          the current device's unique deviceId
          Default is Secure.getString(context.getContentResolver(), Secure.ANDROID_ID).

        • API_VERSION
          the target Sirqul API version your app is to target
          Default is 3.04.

        • APP_VERSION
          the AppVersion set to represent the version of your app.
          Default is 1.0.

        • DEVICE
          the current device's name.
          Default is either Build.MODEL or Build.MANUFACTURER + " " + Build.MODEL if Build.MANUFACTURER and Build.MODEL differ.

        • DEVICE_OS
          the current device's OS version.
          Default is "Android OS " + Build.VERSION.RELEASE + " API-" + Build.VERSION.SDK_INT + " " + Build.ID.

        • DEVICE_MODEL
          the current device model.
          Default is Build.MODEL.

        • DEVICE_TYPE
          the current device's type.
          Default is Enums.DeviceType.HANDHELD.

        • CONNECTION_TIMEOUT
          the connection timeout for general api calls.
          Default is 10000ms.

        • CONNECTION_TIMEOUT_FOR_FILE_UPLOADS
          the connection timeout for file uploads.
          Default is 20000ms.

        • SOCKET_TIMEOUT
          the socket timeout for general api calls.
          Default is 30000ms.

        • SOCKET_TIMEOUT_FOR_FILE_UPLOADS
          the socket timeout for file uploads.
          Default is 300000ms.

        • CUSTOM_USER_AGENT
          a custom user agent, if needed.
          Default is SIRQUL.

        • RETURN_FORMATTED_JSON_STRINGS
          a flag that when enabled, appends a formatted json string of the response on the base response object.
          Default is false.

        • RETURN_JSON_STRINGS
          a flag that when enabled, appends a non-formatted json string of the response on the base response object.
          Default is false.

        • TCP_NO_DELAY_ENABLED
          If false, Nagle's algorithm will be used to help increase latency at a cost of performance.
          Default is true.

        Parameters:
        context - your application or activity context, must not be null.
        bundle - a bundle containing, at least, your Sirqul application and private keys.
        Returns:
        true, if successful. false otherwise.

        the tcpNoDelayEnabled

      • quickAnalytic

        public void quickAnalytic(String tag,
                 Long customId,
                 Long accountId,
                 Location location)
        Send analytic asynchronously. This is a convenience method for sending an analytic but ignoring the response, not caring if it succeeds or not.

        Target API Endpoint: /analytics/usage
        Parameters:
        tag - the tag for the analytics.
        customId - the custom id
        accountId - the account id of the logged in user
        location - the current location of the user
